page.title: 05Multi-racial Wolverhampton
page.content: Following the Second World War immigrants were attracted to this country in increasing numbers by the availability of employment.The 1981 census in Graisley Ward,Wolverhampton recorded 13111 inhabitants,of which 2697 were born in the Commonwealth countries,1950 from India,438 from the Caribean,197 from Africa and 744 from Pakistan. Most have married and had families.The number of children whose father came from these countries was 5144,nearly 40% of all children.In Bingley Junior School 245 out of 292 had such parents and in Bingley Infants School the number was 172 out of 189 These people have brought their own religions,so,in addition to the established churches,there now exists 2 Hindu Temples,1 Sikh Temple and 1 Buddhist Temple in this area.
